content: 1 kari shawl kari shawl is the epitome of meditative knitting no need for counting stitches or row just simple increases at the beginning of each row and after that it s just smooth sailing with garter stitch this is the perfect project when you need to concentrate on other things while knitting like a movie or conversing with your friend over a cup of coffee or wintry road trips when the daylight is scarce the garter stitch creates a squishy warm fabric and the long shape of the shawl makes it ideal for wrapping around your shoulders you can add tassels or pompoms to the corners of the shawl if you like this simple pattern is suitable for beginners ©sari nordlund 2017 2 yarn requirements gauge 550 m/600 yards of dk weight yarn 16 stitches and 38 row 19 ridges per 10 sample is shown in sandnes garn alpakka cm/4 inches gauge is not important 110m/120 yards per 50g shade oker however it may affect the size of your 2035 shawl as well as the amount of yarn required to complete it needles 5 0mm/us 8 circular needles length 80cm size or 32 inches one size length 270 cm/106 inches height 50 cm/19 5 inches ©sari nordlund 2017 3 instructions co 4 stitches with the long tail cast on method row 1 rs k1fb k 3 1 st increased 5 sts on the needles row 2 ws k1fb k 4 1 st increased 6 sts on the needles row 3 rs k1fb k 1 yo k until the end of the row 2 st increased row 4 ws k1fb k 1 yo k until the end of the row 2 st increased repeat row 3-4 73 more times until you have 302 sts on your needles eyelet row k1fb k 1 yo k 2 yo k2tog k 1 until you have 4 sts left k 4 next 2 row k1fb k until the end of the row bind off all stitches as if to knit a good tutorial for making tassels can be found through the techknitting blog http //techknitting blogspot fi/2008/06/how-to-make-tassels html a tutorial for making pompoms without a pompom maker can be found here http //techknitting blogspot fi/2008/05/how-to-make-pom-poms html ©sari nordlund 2017 4 abbreviations used co = cast on k = knit k1fb = knit the next stitch first through its front loop and then through its back loop one stitch increased yo = yarn over an increase k2tog = knit the next two stitches together one stitch decreased st s = stitch es = repeat these stitches as many times as instructed ©sari nordlund 2017
